Title: A Guide to Recording 660FPS Video On A $6 Raspberry Pi Camera
Description: This article will discuss the setup steps that are required for recording videos at high frame rates on cheap Raspberry Pi cameras.  Frame rates up to 660FPS on the V1 camera and up to 1007 on the V2 camera can be achieved.  Filming at these extremely high frame rates on a Raspberry Pi is much more challenging and involves more work than typical point and shoot photography.  This article was primarily written to supplement the instructions in the following video:

Title: Bypassing early 2000s copy protection for software preservation
Description: AKA: Sidestepping copy protection with Masa Mainio

Title: Five takeaways from looking for a new senior role in tech
Description: A few months ago, I left SeatGeek without much of a plan of what to do next. My green card was finally issued in 2021, which means that I didn’t have to scramble to find a new job in forty days. For the first time in the fifteen years I have lived abroad, I could finally take my time without fear of getting on the bad side of immigration authorities. As someone who has been on a work visa for the last fifteen years of my life, this was wild.

Title: The State of External Retina Displays, [Almost] 2022 Edition
Description: The monitor story for Apple computers in [nearly] 2022 is basically would you like garbage, or would you like to take out a home equity loan?

Title: A Review of the Zig Programming Language (using Advent of Code 2021)
Description: I’ve long thought that Zig was an interesting programming language, potentially more interesting than Rust in many respects given that Zig seems to be targetting a more modern C-like language replacement whereas Rust firmly looks like it is trying to take C++ out back like ol' yeller. Rust is powerful, but the language is complicated, and no I’m not talking about the borrow-checker (a completely genius idea) but the language itself is vast and complex.
